title: Metadata Schema and Crosswalk Registry (MSCR)
description: A research tool to manage metadata schema and crosswalks, available in graphical user interface and as an API. Part of the FAIRCORE4EOSC project for the European Open Science Cloud.
dialogContent: ["Full stack developer trainee position ","Contributed to the broad range of activities: from writing documentaiton, tests and setting API endpoints to implementing GUI and configuring CI/CD pipelines"]

title: VR Matkalla App (Feature)
description: VR Matkalla is an app of the state owned railway company VR used by over 100 000 people every month. Our front end feature provides customers a personalized summary of their rail travel history over the past year to increase user engagement and brand loyalty.
dialogContent: ["Student developer in a 9-month-long project", "Designed and implemented a feature for the VR's mobile app from the ground up in close collaboration with VR.", "Delivered production-ready code conforming to the corporate standards including tests, accessiblity features, internationalization.", , "The feature was released in Dec 2023."]

title: Ilya's Page (you are here :)
dialogContent: ["For a small and static website I wanted to only rely on HTML and CSS initially", "Then added JS scripts and Web Components for better maintainability", "Blogs are converted to HTML using markdown-it parser, HTML template and JS script"]

title: Biodiversty Dashboard
description: An interactive dashboard visualizing Finnish biodiversity using publicly available observation data from laji.fi. Key users are high school teachers and students in Finnish schools.
dialogContent: ["Data science-heavy project", "Developed using consulting workflow", "Includes interactive maps and educational material"]

title: MeMo (Junction 2023)
description: Mobile app that deals with sedentary lifestyle among young children by cultivating healthy habits early in life.
dialogContent: ["First hackathon experience", "Developed over the course of two days", "Main feature is a competitive mode. The winner among two participants using dfferent devices is the one who jumps faster â€“ as tracked with accelerometer and gyroscope "]
